sentences.en: As she spoke we could see that she was in a fret.
sentences.cn: 她讲话时,我们看得出她很烦躁.

sentences.en: Don’t fret – everything will be all right.
Don't fret away [ out ] your life.
Don't fret so much about things: I'll think of something!
sentences.cn: 不要操心那些事罢! 我总有法子对付!

sentences.en: Don't fret, Mary. This is all some crazy mistake.
sentences.cn: 不要发愁，玛丽。这只是个有些荒唐的错误。

sentences.en: Don't fret, we'll get there on time.
sentences.cn: 别着急, 我们能准时到那里.

sentences.en: Don't fret; everything will be all right.
sentences.cn: 别发愁, 一切都会好的.

sentences.en: Doubts began to fret his mind.
sentences.cn: 疑虑开始使他心情烦躁.

sentences.en: He could rest only when he was too drained of energy to fret further.
sentences.cn: 只有当他精疲力竭无力再操心时他才能得以休息。

sentences.en: I fret about nothing on earth except papa's illness.
sentences.cn: 在世上除了爸爸的病,什么事也不会使我烦恼.

sentences.en: I see him chafe and fret at every pore.
It won't help to fret about the problem.
sentences.cn: 为这个问题发愁是无济于事的.

sentences.en: men of fifty, fretting that they’re no longer young
sentences.cn: 因不再年轻而烦恼的50岁男人

sentences.en: Peter used to fret about his foolishness.
sentences.cn: 彼得还是常因为自己笨而发愁.

sentences.en: She gets in a fret whenever we're late.
sentences.cn: 只要我们一迟到,她就焦虑不安.

sentences.en: She'll fret herself to death one of these days.
sentences.cn: 她 总 有一天会愁死的.

sentences.en: You need not fret yourself about that.
sentences.cn: 你不必为那件事自寻烦恼.

words.tran_cn: 焦躁的；烦燥的；起波纹的
焦躁的；腐蚀的；附有弦马的
烦躁；侵蚀；耗损（fret的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: （吉他等指板上定音的）品，（从海上飘来的）雾

trans.tran_en: to worry about something, especially when there is no need
to worry about something, especially when there is no need
